job_title: Nurse Case Manager in Imperial Point, FL
pros: EXCELLENT EMR system!!!! It makes total sense and very user friendly.  My coworkers and leadership support me to do my best.  I can ask a million questions and they are there to answer each one. They do their best to try and give clear concise direction and care for your success. My boss is not afraid to roll up her sleeves and pitch in at anytime.  She’s super hands on, and I appreciate the support. I have another coworker that takes me calls on the weekend when I need support. Just amazing. (Those have gotten fewer- thanks to her guidance)
cons: For me, there is a sharp learning curve transitioning from chronic care to acute care. So I find myself falling a bit behind and staying late, as I learn.  That’s kinda annoying, but par for the course of change.  As I keep going - I’ll get better.

job_title: Senior Network Analyst in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Broward Health is a wonderful place to work for. It is a place with a rich cultural Diversity, great pay, amazing benefits' package, great work atmosphere and flexible work schedule (post pandemic). It has a new Leadership, committed to implementing cutting edge technologies to its IT infrastructure. One of the best employers in Broward County.
cons:
Hospitals are fast paced environments, and supporting a hospital IT infrastructure does not come without some stress. But that is the nature of IT. If ever faced with a crisis, be prepared to jump in weather is night or weekends. 
Solution: help run a tight boat and you won't have to be awaken after hours. Trust leadership, and be a team player.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: There are none to bring up
cons: Poorly run hospital system in the peds department. Such a shame since you are dealing with children. Extremely corrupt in the way the managers/directors lead their team. Intimidation, bullying, and backstabbing is how they control their employees. Team work is not tolerated because it disrupts their system. Very unprofessional in the way they approach conflict as they will openly reprimand you in front of other employees. If you have any self worth and won't tolerate their manipulation tactics they will find ways to get you to participate and do it to others. Fellow employees especially the ones that have been there awhile will intentionally try to confuse you so that you make a mistake and then can be written up. Very toxic work environment. The same nurses stay and push the new out. Save yourself the abuse and go somewhere else. Lastly, harassment is tolerated. If there are no witnesses then it did not happen and HR cannot help you. If you are willing to participate then this would probably be a good fit for you but it will lead to a dead end. Take my advice and just go elsewhere.

job_title: Business Operations Analyst in Fort Lauderdale, FL

cons: Have a game plan. It is very political. It is all about who you know, who likes you, and who wants to use your talents. Doing your job well will only get you pigeon holed. Very few merit promotions.

job_title: Senior Clinical Systems Analyst in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros:
Customers - The department managers I supported in the hospitals were dedicated to their work, departments, and the company.  Very cooperative, hard-working, and appreciative of the assistance from IS.  
Great opportunity to learn quickly  - There is a lot of work to be done in IS and that department is always understaffed.
Education - Contracted EMR vendor to hold classes on-site fairly often and encouraged employees to attend training classed. 
Very good pension plan.
cons:
Facility - Old and not clean.  
Teamwork - Support and cooperation by other employees varied widely.  Very frustrating when the issue with my application was a Citrix issue and there was no one available in that department to assist, and when they did have time, they couldn't always resolve the issue.
Management - Middle management had formed clicks and these clicks didn't work well together.  It was obvious they didn't like each.  Important to know who to align oneself with.
Funded by county tax base - facilities and technology were outdated and no money to replace them.

job_title: Trauma Nurse in Atlanta, GA
pros: they are very professional and nice
cons: i barley get any hours

job_title: Senior Clinical Systems Analyst in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Time off and Remote work opportunities.
cons:
Top heavy management
Not enough resources

job_title: Staff Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Good Benefits. The tuition reimbursement is good and the classes offered are well done.  The technology for the most part is up to date. Having med students and residents adds to a positive learning experience. The system is big so you can move around.
cons: The atmosphere is toxic in the ICUs. There is a culture of bullying in some of the ICUs and the floors. The CCU and CVICU are good. The speciality areas are also OK. The medical staff is nice and so are the support services. Unfortunately I would never recommend Broward to any nurse I know. Its not a good place to work overall due to the culture of bullying and negativity. My first day in orientation the phrase “you will be written up “was used 20 times not welcome or we are here for you.. Staff nurses  are not supported just really treated as 2nd class workers. You are expected to move heavy pt alone. No matter what is going on if something doesnt get done its automatically your fault. Dont do it. stay away. There are plenty of other places to work for nurses.

job_title: ICU RN in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: It looks good on your resume and for Trauma experience. It also makes you mentally tough and realize what you DON’T want out of an employer. And on the rare occasion you’ll meet a few good people and have a good day.
cons: You do your job and everyone else’s around you. You chase doctors around by phones all day for orders and can never get what you need until they round on your floor, randomly and unannounced. If you miss them, good luck. If a patient sudden goes critical, good luck. You’re basically on your own. Management blames everything on the nurses. Things rarely go smoothly. There is almost zero communication between anyone, including doctors to nurses and they just expect you to know without utilizing EMR. They use a mix between paper and EMR charts. Everyone has a bad attitude and there is so much unnecessary tension and animosity between nurses. Not a safe place for their patients or your nursing license. No one is happy. Staffing ratios suck. It’s a physician prioritized organization and they only care about the doctors.

review_title: don't relieve you when your shift is done. If you make a big deal about it they deny your vacation request.
job_title: Surgical Technologist in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: It was close to my house that was it, other than that very poor experience, I liked my coworkers that's it because we all felt each other's misery
cons: Under staffed, very underpaid compared to other hospitals, hire less staff to do double the work. No employee recognition they recognize the people that are the bad employees. No reprimanding done by supervision, my supervisors basically checked out were going to school and could care less about their employees. Would let doctors schedule elective cases on weekends, and would require staff to sign up for extra call so they would be able to do so. They didn't give you a thank you or anything it was as if it was expected! all they managers care about is making their numbers and getting their bonuses because they get huge ones. The hospital is under an fbi investigation for corruption and fraud currently.

review_title: Broward Health Coral Springs is a Great Place to Work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coral Springs, FL
pros: Great Benefits including a Pension plan which Broward Health contributes 5% of your salary a year into!  They contribute to the pension, not you,  but there is a 403 B if you want to save too. Administration really listens and wants to do the very best they can. Decent salaries and truly a family atmosphere. Unlike the for profit arena it’s not all about money although there are times finances are tight but this keeps everyone on their toes. A new addition of 50 beds is opening soon. Exciting times for BHCS!
cons: At times our organization hasn’t been as progressive as it needed to be HOWEVER times seem to be changing and we are slowly starting to move ahead.  It’s hard to come up with many negatives. Some people complain about so many items but if you’ve worked at a few hospitals and are able to make comparrisons, then you know this one has something good going on

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Benefits are great there is a pension
cons: No support from administration and very punitive culture

review_title:
Broward Health North HIM 
 Mistreats many of their employees and preys on students
job_title: Coder in Pompano Beach, FL
pros:
Benefits is a positive, Cafeteria food is decent, Opportunity to grow and learn if given an opportunity.
Lots of activities to participate in. In hospital pharmacy for employees and patients, Friendly atmosphere on the surface, follows the rules for patient care. Good Trauma care and nursing training.
cons: You will never be a coder if you’re hired as a tech, cliques are as old as the employees and as gay, inpt coders are nasty, think they’re Divas and abuses other employees . They get special treatment over more qualified employees from management. They take their lunches on time regardless if anyone else hasn’t had lunch, walk breaks, regular breaks are added in . Lots of managerial favoritism. Computers are never locked and very easy to read patients recirds, easy patient access to medical records..no security of medical records. If there was a breach it will not be a surprise. Place to eat is next to a smelly bathroom.

job_title: Administrative in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Nice facility, nice place, decent food
cons: Over worked, treated terrible, underpaid

job_title: CAT Scan Technologist in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Health benefits are good as well as the 403b options.  Most fellow employees are good people.
cons: You are not treated as a person, just a tool to get a job done.  Asked to always do more with less support.  Always running out of supplies to do your job. No consideration for work/life balance.  Work when where and how we say or find another job.  Preaches customer service but then tells you to work faster for unmanageable turnaround times as if you work on an assembly line.

job_title: Sourcing Specialist in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Broward Health has an amazing company culture. I have been supported since the first day I began working here. BH treats each employee with value, respect, and compassion. One thing that has especially stuck out to me is the way that top level management goes out of their way to welcome new employees. This is an organization where your voice is heard, and concerns are considered. The opportunity for growth is tremendous, as they are always looking to promote internally and help initiate employee growth. Broward Health gives you the resources to succeed while guiding you along the way with a supportive team of innovators.
cons: It can sometimes be hard to execute change given the size of the organization, so it is important to learn patience and not expect immediate results. Regardless, BH is certain to make sure you are heard, and efforts are initiated.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros:
Team is great, we all try to help each other.
Very diverse population
Doctors are very nice, not entitled, very approachable
cons:
It's a small hospital so we end up holding pts in ER many times do we have to take care of both admitted pts and ER pts many times of course during season
Since we are holding pts many being ICU. Many times scheduling on floors not appropriate so pts are held in ER because not enough nurses on floors
Sometimes orders for supplies are not put in on time so we run out of supplies

Hospital needs more beds

review_title: Workers locked into roles and blocked from upward mobility. Professional development stymied, must leave to grow
job_title: in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Good health benefits. Good work-life balance as top management is committed to having a good work-life balance for themselves. Corporate office buildings are a ghost town by 5PM Monday to Thursday and earlier on Friday or holidays.
cons:
Management is not adaptable and flexible regarding workforce planning. Workers not encouraged to grow professionally and be upwardly mobile.  
They are required to fill certain routine functions and roles and get blocked if they try to climb out of those repetitive functions/roles. 
Too much favoritism and cronyism.

job_title: IT Senior Analyst in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Benefits, Culture, Employees are nice and trying to help each other regardless of the  incompetent new Chiefs and some Managers.
cons:
IT Dept Leaders running wild.. Incompetent and they do not know what they are doing. They listen to other incompetent Managers to re-act against the hard working employees  in order to shrink the staff and  keep the incompetent Managers to carry on servicing the leaders in dishonest way.
That's Rumble in the Jungle in IT Dept.. especially after the arrival of new Chiefs that have no strategy, as mentioned they listen t incompetent managers that kiss them up to save their jobs..

job_title: Secretary in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Benefits, 401k matching, huge bonus is you're a manager or above
cons: Very top heavy, management get huge bonuses and mistreat employees with no consequences. Managers don't have proper skill set. No job security and employee advocacy. Everyone is worried about stepping on the toes of upper management so there is no one fighting for the little people. It's all about who you know to get ahead. Management let's personal issues get in the way of a properly functioning dept.

review_title: Has been my employment home for over 14 years
job_title: Chief Human Resources Officer in Deerfield Beach, FL
pros: Broward Health is a great company that believes in their physicians and staff. There purpose is to provide excellent patient care to the community and excellent work environment for their employees.
cons: The challenges we face I think are the same as every healthcare facility with retention. We want to groom and retain our new nurses and clinical staff beyond that 2 to 3 year mark. I believe we are in the right path!

job_title: Senior Pharmacy Technician  in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: It seems to be a decent job. Many of the people that I have come in contact with have been here for five plus years, some up to twenty-five years. The insurance starts on the first of the month following the hire date and the rates are fairly reasonable. The hospital goes to great lengths make sure the employees are immunized and healthy to work. Most employees I have met have been fairly cheerful and seem happy to be here.
cons: You have to have thick skin, a strong stomach and a weak sense of smell as many of the patients are often homeless and it can be very upsetting.

job_title: Human Resources Recruiting Partner in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: I've been working at Broward Health HR for the Past 10 years. So far I've had 7 changes in management. Several managers laid off with no explanations. Seems like it's an ongoing thing within the system. There is a constant change in leadership and continues pay issue. Broward Health continues to abuse the write to terminate policy. They will fire or make up reason to fire someone with 3 months without thought or concern. CEO/CFO/COO operate in a rock star status. They are unapproachable and forget trying to voice issues to them because you will never hear back.
cons: Upper management needs to be more engaged with employee related issues, instead of o ly being present during photo opportunities. Respond to messages.

review_title: Great opportunity to learn and grow but nurse to patient ratio are draining
job_title: Registered Nurse in Pompano Beach, FL
pros: Nurses, for the most part, are really helpful and are big on team work
cons: Nurse to patient ratio is draining. Often 6-7:1 in the day shift and 7-8:1 on night shift depending on your unit. They try to keep it to 5-6:1 but they are often short-staffed; high turn-over rate due to burn out

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Good work environment overall and diverse group of co workers.
cons: In the ICU some of the senior nurses are mean and hostile towards new nurses at Broward Health General . The managers let them get away with rude unprofessional behavior on the day shift, it was the worst experience of my career training there in 2007.  After you make it through orientation and become an expert you realize that those nurses behave that way because they are afraid of new nurses of diverse backgrounds outshining them in clinical practice.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Great sense of family within the system! The new leadership shows great initiative for BH’s future! Great relationship building, strong teamwork, commute is reasonable, parking always available, great benefits, position growth, education benefits, flexible scheduling, and fun events!
cons: In an office setting there are too many timely meetings that hinder efficient work flow. Too many skeptical opinions on how BH should be run. Negative press constantly disrupting the positive changes that are trying to be made for a better work environment.

review_title: Best place to work in south florida!
job_title: CLO in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros:
The location is convenient in a beautiful city.
The people that work there care about the Mission which is care for the community.
There are employees there who have worked there for many years, so the intellectual capital is amazing.
The reputation of all services in the community (trauma center, Level 1 NICU, etc.
cons:
Sometimes the large size can cause challenges
Recent senior leader changes have caused the usual and expected transition bumps in the road
Being partially tax assisted has it's polical down sides, although it's good to be re-imbursed for indigent care

review_title: Not a bad system to work in
job_title: Nursing Assistant in Pompano Beach, FL
pros:
Flexible with scheduling around school schedules
HR workers are helpful when needed
Overall experience was decent
Being able to take shifts at other hospitals within the system is a plus
Admin attempts to make changes for the better for FT employees
cons:
Per diem staff should get more pay since they receive no benefits
Per diem staff pay should start based on years of experience
Smokers can take as many smoke breaks as the please
Nurses and CNAs not reprimanded for refusing to assist with a patient when needed
Certain longterm employees are resistant to change, hindering the betterment of the floor environment

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Parkland, FL
pros: It was a good company but I couldn’t keep up due to the fact that I had a family emergency but I was able to get all the help from the company. This is the only information I can share for now. I have nothing else to share.the other thing that I can say is the company is a great company for someone who just started. I don’t know what else to say.
cons: The schedule was conflicted for my family. Again I wish I could have stayed but unfortunately I couldn’t. I had to take care of a wife who was involved in an accident.

job_title: Register in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Whay can i say about this employer? The halls are motly clean the the walls are mostly yellow. Thete are hundreds of name less faces the roam the halls on weekdays and ghost crews the work on weekends and nights.
cons: A promise of every oyher weekends was often said,  yet in reality, most every person's  schedule can be altered the day before.  Gym membership is not needed as the travel from ER to the Cafeteria seems like half a mile hike.

job_title: Pharmacy Manager in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros:
- New leadership is taking active steps to realign the culture within the North Broward Hospital District.
- Moving towards being more technologically advanced.
- Providing staff with the tools they need to efficient, productive, and optimal.
cons: - Changing previous culture of cutting costs and not implementing new processes and technology is slow and tedious.

review_title: The worst career experience of my life
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Interesting work, opportunities to meet many people.  My job in itself was great.  Most of the employees are dedicated and true professionals.  I found the medical/healthcare personnel not only highly qualified but also empathetic to the patients.  There is a real sense of caring.
cons: Elite upper management, promotions given to that management but not to others, no real interest in the common employee, poor HR dept., political, demoralizing atmosphere despite the commitment of its employees to the organization.  Problem with micro-management and control.  Secret surveys given to staff to rate their manager.  Results were discussed, but little  was ever changed.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Miami, FL
pros: Flexible with Schedule, great team help with Patient accounts, documentation in every account always available to help with visit and billing insurance . Management  very helpful if need it.
cons: Under staffed a lot of missing referral and/or authorization from patients and department blamed even when trying our hardest to get information in timely fashion. Low pay increases, not recognized for the amount of hard work done on a daily heavy patient work load. missed lunches to get work complete before end of day do to being under staffed which no lunches was by choice.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Good benefits: health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life, credit union, and a PENSION.
cons: Pay is significantly lower than average in this market. There is a bit of nepotism. If you think, because you're working in a county tax-funded hospital there would be less bs. It's as bad as private industry, but worse: I didn't expect anything like this.

job_title: RN Emergency Department in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Gained a lot of experience and obtained trauma skills. Other than that run as far away as possible , this department is going down hill fast . Killing patients doesn't even matter as long as you kiss butt and " bring in money to the hospital " while being completely abused by staff and patients !
cons: Toxic environment , low pay, no opportunity to grow , you're always dispensable . Management could care less about great nurses and do not value employees and loyalty.

job_title: Clinical Nurse Specialist in Margate, FL
pros: Compensation with salary and accrued time off is very good. Exposure to very complex and interesting case load. Comprehensive services under one roof.
cons: Public funded so a lot of red tape to get supplies needed for work. Hiring process is questionable since all applications are first screened by HR, with only the ones they deem acceptable being passed on to the managers.

review_title: My experience as a new employee at Broward Health has been very enjoyable.
job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: The endless career growth opportunities and wonderful culture that has been created by leadership. Our team works together very well and are able execute tasks at hand.
cons: Very fast paced work environment but is easily managed with good work structure. You have to be very disciplined and able to prioritize your work in order to be successful.

job_title: in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: The staff is wonderful and we have the best doctors
cons: Administration does not care about employees only coming in under budget. Work load is ridiculous and unsafe due to budget cuts.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Executive Leadership is very determined to make this a top organization to work for! Great hours, flexible scheduling, great teamwork amongst coworkers, and the innovative attitude, the community outreach is awesome as well! Also, the team building exercises to keep everyone in sync is wonderful!
cons: The most negative con is the misguided negativity from outside sources! The past is the past and everyone deserves the chance to be better!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Before new management came in, this was a nice place to work.  Very challenging and rewarding work.
cons: New management treats their employees as commodities.  They are only interested in the bottom line.  They manage by intimidation.  There have been many times the upper management screams at their employees.  You are afraid to make any mistakes and always walk around on pins and needles.

job_title: in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros:
Benefits and nothing else
Benefits and nothing else
Benefits and nothing else
Benefits and nothing else
cons:
IT Department is Very Corrupt.
They post positions, but they have already picked up who will fill the position without even giving the chance for other internal candidates to be interviewed.
If you are not close to the managers and reporting what others say and do, then you are not good employee..
I wish the hospital was privately owned, None of those IT corrupt managers would have stayed in their positions.
They contract with outside Vendors for non functioning equipment..easy to figure out why..
The IT should be outsourced and uproot the corruption

job_title: Registered Nurse in Pompano Beach, FL
pros: great coworkers, nice managers, great team work, managers are very involved in improving the environment for both nurses and patients.
cons: get cancelled 2-3 days in a row,  per diem status for new grads is that you have to work 3 days weekly and every other weekend , just like full time but without the benefits.

review_title: IPMC Pharmacist was best job ever
job_title: Pharmacist in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: great pay, flexible schedule, valued as an employee, easy to get time off, really nice co-workers, manager spoke with staff before implementing changes and sometimes did not implement when staff opposed ideas
cons: lots of turnover at Broward General, not all broward health facilites are the same, employees being asked to destaff because over-budget

job_title: Human Resources in Pompano Beach, FL
pros: I have worked for BH 10 years now. It’s a great organization to work for. I have been able to advance within the system numerous times. Management wants to see you succeed and reach your goals. Broward Health offers great benefits, education reimbursement, advancement, and much more. I feel like BH is my family and enjoy working here.
cons: For me, there are no cons.

review_title: Rewarding, educational and provides opportunity for career growth and develope close interpersonal relationships
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: The friendliness of the staff, state of the arc equipment,the excellent quality of care given by the highly experienced personel. The attractiveness of the physical structure and rhe accessibility of services.
cons: some very inconsiderate and uncaring managers/supervisors who show lack of respect for workers

job_title: Anonymous in Tamarac, FL
pros: The benefits are great with opportunity for growth.
cons: Management tends to be very disrespectful! They do shady things to employees and gets away with it. There are too many employees keeping quiet as to whats really going on within. The moment you go to HR to report them they use that against you and mistreat you even the more. They do whatever it takes to get rid of you especially when they don't like you. Its a lot of favoritism that goes on.

review_title: Good things come to those who wait!
job_title: Benefits Technician in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Amazing leadership! Amazing benefits! Amazing people!
cons: The ONLY downside is that the reputation, cultural and spirit of Broward Health has been tainted with bad news for years, so employee engagement can be challenging but we are extremely hopeful, enthused and excited about the great deal of influential events that are taking place in the near future.

review_title: Used to be great but now a huge mess.
job_title: Various in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Good pay and benefits, nice people and large company doing good things for patients. Pension, 403B, some good doctors, room to transfer or grow, paid tuition.
cons: New CEO is spending the company into ruins. Bad management decisions. Lots of layoffs, unstable environment, extremely political and shady.

job_title: LMHC in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Benefits are great, good working environment, competitive salary, advancement possibilities, coworkers on my team are great.  Going into my 21st year working here, so that should tell you something.
cons: Not just at Broward Health, but major changes in healthcare, which in turn have changes in how healthcare organizations do business.

review_title: Not as good as you may think
job_title: Senior PM in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Health Insurance, 5% pension, great place to work except for managers
cons: Micromanagement, managers with zero people skills, managers create a non-trust environment, manager can target employees, retaliation from managers if you speak to HR or Compliance. HR and Compliance do not care about employees and all complaints are informed to upper management and managers.

job_title: in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros:
large company with many opportunities in all directions including: IT, accounting, medical, service...
great benefits
cons: None. But it all depends on who your boss and co-workers are since seniority can be seen. Some departments are packed with employees that are 15 to 25+ years there.

job_title: Pathology Aide in Coral Springs, FL
pros: great benefits and  a very good manager theres a family type atmosphere its a nice place to go to work everyday
cons: working at broward health coral springs was nice but the for me there was a doctor who didnt like anyone who wasnt Iranian and that was an issue for me

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Working with premature infants and their families.
cons: Management in the NICU and the hospital does not care a bit about their employees in the unit.  Huge turnover where they are always hiring young, inexperienced nurses due to budget cuts.  The unit is a disgusting mess, with old equipment and not enough cleaning staff.  5 patients per nurse has become a norm in there which is a hug safety issue.    Lots of gossiping between the nurses and employees are continuously dissatisfied which makes for a terrible work environment

job_title: Senior Project Manager in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Leadership provides opportunities for growth as well as new opportunities. Friendly towards consultants. Overcoming previous challenges related to physician contracts and related fines is impressive.
cons: The board of commissioners lack of ability to provide clear oversight and they get involved with operations and ongoing bottle neck in the legal department.

job_title: in Orlando, FL
pros: I learned from the pros.  Very supportive and professional.  I worked at The Wellness Center under Kevin Hall supervision back in 2001 and he was a great boss.  He also had the best staff.  They really care about their patients and members.
cons: I loved to work for The Wellness Center.  Always have great memories of everyone.

review_title: good opportunity to gain clinical experience at a small scale community hospital
job_title: Management in Coral Springs, FL

benefits and compensation are very good. small hospital where most employees know each other
less stressful envrionment than most hospitals.
cons:
management seems to be  focused on the bottom line instead of leadership. very political.
training and mentoring is lacking.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL

They pay low, very low.
It is hard to get promotion or change position.
most time when you try to get into another position they try to cut your pay instead of increasing your salary.

review_title: Too bad about the fatcats at the top...
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Great place to learn.  For the most part a friendly, happy place, welcoming of new employees.  Mostly good collaboration with the doctors.
cons: Administration lacks the trust of employees.  Disrespectful street-level patients and visitors.  Scandalous reputation from lawsuits, FBI investigations, and fraud convictions.

review_title: Wroking with a World class healthcare system
job_title: Speech-Language Pathologist in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Strong leadership - solid financial future - good benefits - great opportunity to help the community - ample diversity of population served - flexibility accomodating professional and personal responsibilities
cons: Salary not competitive with the private sector - limited opportunity for professional advancement

job_title: Middle Management in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Salary is competitive,  Most employees have grown within the company to high levels. Stable company with great benefits.
cons: laid back attitude and departmentalized.  Need to be restructured for efficiency.  There is a need for more training.  People get promoted into positions they are not skilled for.

review_title: Great CEO, Good hours, Bad pay,
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: A few of the people I worked with were great! However, the department I worked in was small, so there was a lot of drama between people. Honestly, it was a job. That's pretty much the only pro.
cons: TERRIBLE PAY! Sometimes, you can feel unappreciated by senior management.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL

Medical plans

Vision coverage

job_title: Medical Technologist in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Good people doing good work.  Pay on is on par with other local laboratories.
cons: None I can think of.

job_title: Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Great people to work with. Manager was very accommodating and pleasant. Loved my job taking care of patients.
cons: Low pay, no bonuses, raises or benefits if you’re not full time. They constantly flex you in order to save money.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Being in a diverse range of people, friendly, helpful employees, and an understanding boss was the best reason I liked working at Broward Medical Health
cons: There was no down side of working at Broward Medical Health , everyone was friendly and helpful. The reason for me leaving was only because I relocted.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coral Springs, FL
pros: Benefits and pay; especially the pension as most companies do not have one.  Great work environment. Managers care about employees.
cons: None that I can think of. Broward Health like other organizations has opportunities but they are committed to investing in infrastructure and supporting employees.

job_title: Staff RN in Fort Lauderdale, FL

cons: heavy work load, limited overtime

job_title: Educator in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: I am so excited to finally be in my dream job. I have worked in the Broward Health system for 23 years and have grown with the system and finally in my dream job’

review_title: I love working at the Broward Health Foundation, the fundraising arm of Broward Health.
job_title: Prospect Research Coordinator in Fort Lauderdale, FL

cons: Working in a small Foundation for a large healthcare system is a curse and a blessing.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL

Nurses work with outdated orders because doctors never discontinue or update orders (your license is never safe at Broward).

review_title: Broward Health is a fantastic organization that invests in its employees. I am happy to work for this company.
job_title: Vice President in Fort Lauderdale, FL

review_title: Great place to learn and my coworkers are amazing. We work on a neuro telemetry unit with a 6 bed step down unit.

job_title: Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: None, this place is really horrible. I have nothing good to say, except to stay away, go somewhere will you will be treated with respect.

job_title: Human Resources in Fort Lauderdale, FL

review_title: Great place to learn, management is Terrible!
job_title: EKG Monitor Technologist in Parkland, FL
pros: Great Place to work if you were on the Newer side of the Hospital! Young energetic staff, always friendly.
cons: Management is terrible. They do not stick up for their staff and have no problem letting you know you are replaceable.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Teamwork and great nurses. The staff really know how to work as a team.
cons: Understaff, high patient to nurse ratio due to nurses calling out.

job_title: Staff RN in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: I have been working at broward health for 7 years. Not a good place to work. The only reason I am still working is because my NM is nice.
cons: Short staff all the time. No team work whatsoever ever. Management is horrible.  Too much gossip and backstabbing. Not a good place to achieve your goals.

review_title: Where hope and career advancement goes to die
job_title: Senior Project Manager in Delray Beach, FL
pros:
Decent benefits 
401k matching 
Pension
cons:
Lazy co-workers 
Zero career growth 
Management has zero clue how to manage 
IT is ruled by fear, micromanaging and unqualified people 
Everybody stays here to hit their 5 year mark for a pension and then leaves
There has been a mass exodus from IT the last year and a half

Bad and unsafe work environment. 
Culture of blame. 
Poor choice in management/leadership.

review_title: Dont work unless you want to give you life up

review_title: They put the HELL in Broward Health
job_title: Administrative Secretary in Fort Lauderdale, FL

cons:
Micromanaging control freak who dominated my every move.
Co-workers that were able to get away with screaming loud laughter and nonstop talking never punished.
Incorrect information on benefits, HR given at every turn.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL

cons:
Favoritism toward employees of the same race/ethnicity.
Can be a very busy/hostile environment to work in at times.
Changes are made without employee input.
